newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates unchanged amid dull trade.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates unchanged amid dull trade.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates were unchanged on Saturday in dull trade amid rumours, denied by officials, of an increase in sales tax, dealers said.
"Mill owners kept on the sidelines on rumours that sales tax had been raised to 18 percent from 10. But by evening, the rumours were found to be false," dealer Kishan Chand said.
He said uncertainty persisted about the size of the cotton crop and prices could rise if cotton production proves to be below government estimates.
In the kerb market, NIAB-78 was traded at 2,150 rupees ($53.45) to 2,175 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) and K-68 at around 2,300 rupees, dealers said.
Saturday's official spot rates issued by the Karachi Cotton Association in rupees per maund:
